title: Shevuot
text: (Deuteronomy 19:17) "then both the men shall stand" - Scripture is talking about witnesses.
You say it is about witnesses,
but could it not be about litigants?
(Deuteronomy 19:17) "between whom the controversy is," the litigants are now mentioned. So, what do I do with "then both the men shall stand"?
And if you are inclined to speak, [note that] that it says here "both," and it says later (Deuternomy 19:17) "both." Just like there, it is about witnesses, so here, it is about witnesses.
What if are inclined to speak?

"Since it did not write 'and between whom the controversy is,' the entire verse applies to litigants," [you should note that] it says here "both," and it says later (Deuternomy 19:17) "both." Just like there, it is about witnesses, so here, it is about witnesses.
